dt-example.title: Custom child row renderer
dt-example.info:
The child row's for a collapsed table in Responsive, by default, show a `-tag ul/li` list of the data from the hidden columns. The `r-init responsive.details.renderer` option provide the ability to create your own custom renderer. It is given three parameters: the DataTables API instance for the table, the row index to use and an array of information about the columns - please refer to the `r-init responsive.details.renderer` documentation for full details of the object structure used in the array for each column.
This example shows the `columns` parameter that is passed in to display information only about the columns that Responsive has hidden. You could refine this to select only certain columns, or show all columns, etc.
